S.FORM: jiyax sayang dhuq ku empitu patas hidaw sapah pyasan ka yaku.
S.TRANSL: 我今天七點到學校。
I arrived at school at seven today.

S.FORM: Prajing sluhay da, mtmay pyasan ka emptgsa, rmngaw ka qbsuran pyasan, “Hiyug! Thmuku!” msa.
S.TRANSL: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」
It's time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

S.FORM: Paru bi ka hnang nami rmngaw, “emptgsa embiyax su.”
S.TRANSL: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”

S.FORM: Smluhay nami siida, tmgsa mnan kari seejiq sppgan ka emptgsa.
S.TRANSL: 我們上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。
In class, the teacher taught us the seejiq language of numbers.

S.FORM: Sneegul nami emptgsa smpug, meuyas nami uyas sppgan.
S.TRANSL: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

S.FORM: Egu bi ka snlhayan mu kari seejiq.
S.TRANSL: 我學會好多族語。
I have learned many seejiq languages.

S.FORM: Musa ku sapah pyasan kdjiyax, smluhay ku kari seejiq kdjiyax, skari ku kari Seejiq qbhangun mu bubu.
S.TRANSL: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要說族語給媽媽聽。
I go to school every day, I learn the seejiq language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

S.FORM: Tumun ka hangan mu.
S.TRANSL: 我的名字是Tumun。
My name is Tumun.

S.FORM: Walis ka hangan tama mu.
S.TRANSL: 我爸爸的名字是Walis。
My dad's name is Walis.

S.FORM: Iwan ka hangan bubu mu.
S.TRANSL: 我媽媽的名字是Iwan。
My mother's name is Iwan.

S.FORM: Maxal ka hngkwasan mu hngkawas nii.
S.TRANSL: 我今年10歲。
I am 10 years old.

S.FORM: Niqan ku Kingal qbsuran snaw, Kuras ka hangan na, maxal kingal ka hngkwasan na hngkawas nii.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個哥哥，他叫kuras，他今年11歲。
I have a brother, his name is kuras, he is 11 years old.

S.FORM: Seupu nami meuyas patas kingal sapah pyasan ka yami.
S.TRANSL: 我們在同一間學校讀書。
We study in the same school.

S.FORM: Smkuxul meuyas uyas ka yaku ni qbsuran snaw.
S.TRANSL: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。
Both my brother and I like to sing.

S.FORM: Smkuxul ku tmapaq qsiya ka yaku, msangay o seupu nami musa tmapaq qsiya ka tnsapah.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

S.FORM: Smkuxul ku pkkla bgurah dangi ka yaku, tduwa nami seupu musa meuyas uyas ni tmapaq qsiya.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡交新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

S.FORM: Laqi ku Seejiq Balay ka yaku.
S.TRANSL: 我是賽德克族的小孩。
I am an Seejiq child.

S.FORM: Ga nami mniqa Hori.
S.TRANSL: 我們家住在埔里。
Our family lives in Hori.

S.FORM: Niqan rima hiyi ka tnsapah mu.
S.TRANSL: 我們家共有五個人。
There are five people in our family.

S.FORM: Niqan tru ka mnswayi nami.
S.TRANSL: 我們有三個兄弟姊妹。
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

S.FORM: Gisu ku tuhuy mniq tama, bubu, qbsuran snaw ni qbsuran qrijil.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

S.FORM: Bowqax bi ka tama mu, key-sa-cu ka tama mu.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。
My father is tall and he is a policeman.

S.FORM: Hlawax ka bubu mu, empsapuh ka bubu mu.
S.TRANSL: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

S.FORM: Mniq sapah o skari kari Seejiq rmngaw mnan ka tama.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。
My father speaks the ethnic language with us at home.

S.FORM: Msangay rbagan o ida nami musa alang.
S.TRANSL: 我們暑假都會回部落。
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

S.FORM: Yaku ni qbsuran o tuhuy qmraq qpatur.
S.TRANSL: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

S.FORM: Kuxul mu bi ka tnsapah mu.
S.TRANSL: 我很喜歡我們家的人。
I like our family very much.

S.FORM: Tuhuy ku bubu mu musa rmigaw.
S.TRANSL: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。
I went out with my mother today.

S.FORM: Mgkarac bi ka karac baraw, ini kskuy ni ini ktalux uri, ltu ka bgihur.
S.TRANSL: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

S.FORM: Tluung nami babaw sspriq mkan meyn-paw, smbu qbubur ka rdax hidaw, muxul balay.
S.TRANSL: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

S.FORM: Babaw ska hidaw do, maa embanah ka karac da.
S.TRANSL: 下午，天空變紅了。
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

S.FORM: Smiling ku bubu mu, ma embanah ka karac baraw hug?
S.TRANSL: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的?
I asked my mother why the sky is red.

S.FORM: Yabi meiyah ka bgihur paru da, msa ka bubu.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

S.FORM: Keeman ungac rulung ka karac baraw, smriyu ka ppngrah da.
S.TRANSL: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

S.FORM: Mmowsa nami sapah uri da.
S.TRANSL: 我們也要回家了。
We were going home too.

S.FORM: Mniq ku kska elug seusa sapah, smulu ku ppngrah.
S.TRANSL: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願。
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

S.FORM: Tay saw uxay meiyah ka bgihur paru, mkmusa ku bi rmigaw nganguc na.
S.TRANSL: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

S.FORM: Gaga siyaw sapah nami ka sapah pyasan mu, mksa ku musa sapah pyasan kdjiyax, mksa ku meiyah sapah uri.
S.TRANSL: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

S.FORM: Uxay ka paru ka sapah pyasan nami, ini khbaraw ka empeuyas patas mttkla nami kana.
S.TRANSL: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

S.FORM: Mssli tlaman kana ka lqlaqi, tuhuy hmrapas boru, tuhuy pprngaw kari.
S.TRANSL: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

S.FORM: Ida tuhuy mnan mhrapas uri ka emptgsa, saw bi kingal tnsapah ka sapah pyasan.
S.TRANSL: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

S.FORM: Smsik nami kdjiyax ka yami, asi ka bliqun smsik ka pyasan nami.
S.TRANSL: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

S.FORM: Duma seejiq o musa smrus gagi bling, duma seejiq o musa smsik dxgal.
S.TRANSL: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

S.FORM: Ssikun nami kana ka kkmuhing sapah pyasan, mseasug ni mddayaw nami, ida bgurah bi kdjiyax ka sapah pyasan.
S.TRANSL: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

S.FORM: Shiga Mnusa ku alang qmita tama rudan.
S.TRANSL: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

S.FORM: Bsiyaq nami ini tqita da, lnglungun mu bi ka hiya.
S.TRANSL: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。
We haven't seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

S.FORM: Qmita bi knan ka tama rudan do, qlalun ku na sikwa, pmahun ku na ocya.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

S.FORM: Shiya bi ka hnuma sikwa tama rudan, malu bi uqun.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

S.FORM: Kuxul mu bi ka ocya tama rudan uri, malu bi mahun uri.
S.TRANSL: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。
I also like grandpa's tea, it's tasted good too.

S.FORM: Ska hidaw do yaku ni bubu rudan o seupu nami hmapuy uqun ska hidaw.
S.TRANSL: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

S.FORM: Hnapuy egu bi uqun ska hidaw ka bubu rudan, niqan qsurux, niqan rudux, niqan baun, niqan ka pngusul uri.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

S.FORM: Mnkan nami uqun ska hidaw do, musa nami mabal sama smaan.
S.TRANSL: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

S.FORM: Mangal egu bi bunga, sari ni qusul sbgay na knan ka bubu rudan, pdsun na knan musa sapah.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

S.FORM: Mswayay ku dhyaan ni rngagan mu, “yahun namu qmita babaw duri.”
S.TRANSL: 我跟他們道別，說下次再去看他們。
I said goodbye to them and said I'd see them next time.

S.FORM: Jiyax sayang madas mnan musa qlangan ssamac ka emptgsa, msbkug nami rhngun marig kipu.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

S.FORM: Mtmay nami qnalang ssamac do, rmngaw ka emptgsa, “brah o dqduda, bukuy o dquyu, usa nanaq qmita.”
S.TRANSL: so you can visit them yourself.""
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

S.FORM: Ksugun mu bi ka quyu, uxay ku musa qmita quyu ka yaku.
S.TRANSL: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

S.FORM: Egu bi ka qduda gaga skkaya babaw pusu qhuni.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去。
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

S.FORM: Ruwan qnalang ssamac ga, niqan dapa wiwil muhing, dmai ni rklic, ini mu bi qtai na ka ssamac nii, mqaras ku balay qtaan mu sayang da.
S.TRANSL: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

S.FORM: Egu bi ka pnsingan mu sasing, saun mu pqita tama mu ni bubu mu.
S.TRANSL: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

S.FORM: Babaw do tuhuy ku tama ni bubu miyah ku duri.
S.TRANSL: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。
Next time I will come with my parents.

S.FORM: Jiyax sngayan nii ga, yaku ni qbsuran qrijil musa nami Taytung qmita swayi snaw tama.
S.TRANSL: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔。
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

S.FORM: Kndadax nami Taypey teapa rulu qrngul musa Taytung.
S.TRANSL: 我們從台北搭火車去臺東。
We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

S.FORM: Dhuq nami Taytung do pgriq rulu miyah smtrung mnan ka swayi snaw tama.
S.TRANSL: 到了台東，叔叔開車來接我們。
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

S.FORM: Sapah swayi snaw tama sdalih tgaan rulu, mgriq rulu o ini biyaw dhuq.
S.TRANSL: 車站離叔叔家很近，開車一下子就到了。
The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.

S.FORM: Kiyig sapah swayi snaw tama o niqan llabang bi qnalang tbugan, seupu nami teapa ddeynsya musa tbugan.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。
There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

S.FORM: Mniq nami ruwan qnalang tbugan hini, madas mnan musa tmabug miric ni teapa dmai ka swayi snaw tama.
S.TRANSL: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

S.FORM: Keeman do seupu nami musa mkan nhapuy sapah uqan.
S.TRANSL: 晚上，我們一起去餐廳吃飯。
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

S.FORM: Ida egu bi rulu ka s-cyu, kiya ni teapa nami utubay musa hiya.
S.TRANSL: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

S.FORM: Mmiyah nami sapah siida, wada guyun da utubay, kiya ni teapa nami basu meiyah sapah da.
S.TRANSL: 我們要的時返家時，摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車回家。
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

S.FORM: Sayang do gaga nami dhuq Taypey da, ya wada slayun ka utubay swayi snaw tama dhug?
S.TRANSL: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有。
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.

S.FORM: Slaqi ku siida mniq nami Holi, meuyas patas do thjil Taycung da, bitaq sayang gisu nami mniq alang paru na.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我們家住在埔里，上學以後，就搬到了台中，一直在都市裡生活。
When we were young, our family lived in Puli. After I started school, we moved to Taichung and have been living in the city ever since.

S.FORM: Meuyas ku pyasan paru do, mnegaaw ku kingal quri knkla kndusan seejiq tnpusu slhayan, klaan saw seejiq tnpusu Taywan ga niqan egu kleegan ka knkla kndusan.
S.TRANSL: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

S.FORM: Kiya ni, sngayan rbagan nii do, yaku ni qbsuran snaw ga musa nami alang smiling rudan, mkmkla quri kndusan mnan nanaq.
S.TRANSL: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

S.FORM: Kingal wada mspac kmxalan hngkwasan na rudan, ida mbiyax bi qtaan na.
S.TRANSL: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

S.FORM: Smiling ku hyaan, piya ka klaun su rmngaw kari hug? Ida mkla bi rmngaw kari Seejiq, mkla rmngaw kari Tayal, kari Tanah Tunux uri ka hiya.
S.TRANSL: 我問他會哪些語言，他的賽德克語說得很流利，也會說泰雅語與日本話。
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Seejiq, as well as Atayal and Japanese.

S.FORM: Kla kndadax slaqi siida, smnluhay kari Tanah Tunux, Tayal ka qrijil na, qpqhan na hiya o hbaraw bi ka klaan na seejiq Khilang, kiya ni egu bi ka klaan na rmngaw kari.
S.TRANSL: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學日本話，太太是泰雅族人，而他工作上認識許多客家人，所以他會說這麼多語言。
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Atayal, and he knows many Hakkas at work, so he can speak so many languages.

S.FORM: Smiling nami siida, smnru egu bi quri knklaan rdrudan sbiyaw ka rudan nii.
S.TRANSL: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

S.FORM: Ana nanaq ini lxani mkla qmbahang o, ida nami wada sru-ing ruwan qnawal baga, tduwa saun qmbahang duri.
S.TRANSL: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。
Although we could't fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

S.FORM: Slaqi ku siida, ini ku kla kndusan rudan sbiyaw, sqaun mu saw pneiyah ku seejiq tnpusu ka yaku.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。
When I was young, I didn't understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

S.FORM: Egu ka klaun do pqniqan nanaq lnglungan da, mqaras ku balay, yasa Seejiq ku Balay ka yaku.
S.TRANSL: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為賽德克族，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。
The more I know, the more I feel that being a Seejiq is unique and something to be proud of.

S.FORM: Meiyah sapah gbiyan kiya da swayi snaw.
S.TRANSL: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。
My younger brother is going home this evening.

S.FORM: Yaku ni bubu rudan o musa nami marig hiyi rudux brigan damac, sramal swayi snaw mhapuy uqun keeman.
S.TRANSL: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

S.FORM: Mnuda nami bbrigan sama, niqan egu bi klgan sama ka bbrigan sama hiya.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了菜攤，那裏有好多新鮮的青菜。
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

S.FORM: Bnarig nami eyncay, lmbay ni ningjing.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

S.FORM: Rmngaw ka gaga mniq siyaw bbrigan hiyi qhuni embbarig, “Shiya bi uqun ka kalac mu ni qlupas mu, brigi cikuh hug!” msa.
S.TRANSL: 在旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

S.FORM: Bnarig nami kalac ni qlupas.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。
We bought pineapples and peaches.

S.FORM: Muda nami bbrigan hiyi rudux siida, rmngaw ka embbarig, “Marig su manu hug? Paru ni msiyang ka hiyi rudux nii, kingal o tru kbkuy brigan.” msa.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today's chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

S.FORM: Sihan mkray bi brigan bubu rudan, kiya ni smiling embbarig, “Ya tduwa mhnuk hari brigan hug?”
S.TRANSL: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆:「可不可以便宜一點？」
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

S.FORM: Kiya ka kiya ni embbarig o suqi mhnuk da! msa rmngaw ka embbarig, uxay tduwa blihun da.
S.TRANSL: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

S.FORM: Siyaw na embbarig o, “Aguh marig qsurux mu, paru ni mhnuk brigan ka qsurux mu.” msa.
S.TRANSL: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

S.FORM: Hici do bnarig nami hiyi rudux ni hiyi qsurux, musa nami sapah do egu ka hnapuy nami damac.
S.TRANSL: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

S.FORM: Bsiyaq ka tnaga do, mkuung ka karac da.
S.TRANSL: 等了好久，天已經黑了。
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

S.FORM: Miyah ka qnawal swayi snaw rmngaw, “ini tduwa msangay ka hey-tay, asi ka babaw jiyax sngayan do kika miyah ku da.” msa.
S.TRANSL: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn't take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

S.FORM: Rmngaw ka bubu rudan, “Egu balay ka hnapuy damac, lwani kana ka dhiya, aguh mkan” ksa.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶說:「已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!」
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let's eat together!

S.FORM: Lwanun nami ka lupung ni dangi, aguh seupu mkan egu nhapuy keeman.
S.TRANSL: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

S.FORM: Niqan kingal ka tnhiyan mu muyas patas, Basaw ka hangan na, ida smhungi madas qyqaya kjiyax.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個同學叫Basaw，他常常忘記帶東西。
I have a classmate named Basaw, he often forgets to bring things.

S.FORM: Smluhay siida, kmbarux ppatas, ssrus uxay uri o klabuy spatas gnexalan ka hiya.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

S.FORM: Enkingal, endha, entru, srwaun dha kmbarux qyqaya ka hiya.
S.TRANSL: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

S.FORM: Kiya ka kiya ni mluhay kmbarux do ini na bqani ka knbrxan na da.
S.TRANSL: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

S.FORM: Hici do ini nami srwai kmbarux qyqaya da.
S.TRANSL: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

S.FORM: Niqan kingal jiyax, seupu nami musa mkksa nganguc.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。
One day, we all went on an outing together.

S.FORM: Mkksa ni mkmusa saan psnganguc ka Basaw, ida ini adas klabuy ssrus ka hiya.
S.TRANSL: 路途中，Basaw想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。
On the way, Basaw wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

S.FORM: Kiya ni kmbarux klabuy ssrus gnexalan ka hiya, ida smiyuk rmngaw hyaan ini ku adas uri msa.
S.TRANSL: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn't bring them either.

S.FORM: Basaw o tbiyax mlingis da, msaang rmngaw ni, “Ma namu ini sruwa kmbarux klabuy ssrus knan kana!”
S.TRANSL: Basaw急的哭了出來。他生氣的說:「為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!!」
Basaw burst into tears. He said angrily, why don't everyone lend me toilet paper!

S.FORM: Rmngaw hyaan ka gnexalan, yasa ini su nanaq adas ni kbrxun su o ini su bqani da!
S.TRANSL: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!
The classmate told him, because you didn't bring it yourself, and you wouldn't return the things lent to you!

S.FORM: Kusun do, mgrbu bi miyah sapah pyasan ka Basaw, bqanan na gnexalan kana ka knbrxan na qyqaya.
S.TRANSL: 隔天上學，Basaw很早就到學校了，把跟同Basaw學借的東西都還給同學們。
The next day at school, Basaw arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

S.FORM: Msiqa ni rmngaw gnexalan na ka Basaw, kiya ni rmngaw, “peadas ku nanaq qyqaya babaw da, mhuway namu balay knbarux qyqaya knan.”
S.TRANSL: Basaw向同學們道歉，並說:「他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。」
Basaw aw apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

S.FORM: Emptsamac alang ka tama mu.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

S.FORM: Slaqi ku siida, tama ni swayi snaw tama ga keeman do madas pucing ni puniq wada lmiqu.
S.TRANSL: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

S.FORM: Mrdax ka karac do madas nangal dha samac miyah da.
S.TRANSL: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

S.FORM: Mnsuwil madas bowyak, mnsuwil madas rapic, mnsuwil niqan ka glaqung uri.
S.TRANSL: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

S.FORM: Qhduun dha measug rhngun nganguc han, kika seasug seejiq tnealang da.
S.TRANSL: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

S.FORM: Rngagun mu kjiyax ka tama, mkmusa ku snegul tama musa tmsamac.
S.TRANSL: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: “Paru su do dsun misu lmiqu da.” msa ka tama.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說:「等我長大了他再帶我一起去。」
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

S.FORM: Ida mduuy durang qmraq ssamac uri ka dsnaw alang, mkla smalu durang ni dangar ka dhiya.
S.TRANSL: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

S.FORM: Ida mkla bi smalu durang ka tama mu, “Sqraq glaqung ka nii, bliqun nami kmuruy ka daping qaqay ssamac, bsaun elug daun ssamac ka durang.” msa ka tama.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

S.FORM: Iyux bi knhari seupu drudan musa tmsamac, kiya ni sluhay ku smalu durang kdjiyax, ini biyaw tduwan qmraq samac ka durang mu da.
S.TRANSL: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

S.FORM: Qmita ka tama do rmngaw knan, “isu ka musa mkla bi tmsamac hici da” msa.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定很會打獵。
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

S.FORM: Sayang do paru ku da, meapa ku bhniq ni buji mu, sneegul ku tama musa tmsamac.
S.TRANSL: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: Dhuq alang do seasug mu seejiq tnealang ka nangal mu ssamac.
S.TRANSL: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

S.FORM: “Ida gnealu utux rudan ka nii, seangal ta na egu bi ssamac.” msa ka tama.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

S.FORM: Msuqi ku musa sapah pyasan ka mrbu da.
S.TRANSL: 我早上上學遲到了。
I was late for school this morning.

S.FORM: Shungi ku madas lubuy patas ka musa sapah pyasan da.
S.TRANSL: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

S.FORM: Ini ku adas ana manu.
S.TRANSL: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。
I didn't bring anything with me.

S.FORM: Meuyas patas siida, mseupu nami qmita patas ka thiyan mu muyas patas.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

S.FORM: Pnspungan siida, kbxan ku na ppatas ni ssrus ka thiyan mu muyas patas.
S.TRANSL: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

S.FORM: Rngagan ku na ka emptgsa, “nhari tutuy ka babaw na da, iya hari msuqi da!”
S.TRANSL: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」
The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""

S.FORM: Dangi mu ka Tusan, laqi seejiq balay ka hiya uri.
S.TRANSL: 我的好朋友叫Tusan，他也是賽德克族的小孩。
My good friend's name is Tusan, and he is also an Seejiq child.

S.FORM: Mseupu nami muyas patas alang Truku.
S.TRANSL: 我們一起在德鹿谷部落讀書。
We study together in the Truku tribe.

S.FORM: Qbahang nami snruan kari ka rudan sbiyaw kdjiyax, mkla nami balay rmngaw kari seejiq balay.
S.TRANSL: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說賽德克語。
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the seejiq proficiently.

S.FORM: Bowqax ni qthur ka yaku, llbu ni mliwang ka Tusan.
S.TRANSL: 我很高也很胖，Tusan很矮也很瘦。
I am tall and overweight, while Tusan is short and thin.

S.FORM: Niqan bi bbiyax ka Tusan, smkuxul hiya kana ka seejiq.
S.TRANSL: Tusan很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。
Tusan is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

S.FORM: Yun-tung-kay sapah pyasan ka sayang, mowda egu bi pspung ka sapah pyasan.
S.TRANSL: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

S.FORM: NIqan brbil wasil, boru qqahan, tmalang, rmgrig ni smbu buji.
S.TRANSL: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.

S.FORM: Pspung ku tmalang ka yaku.
S.TRANSL: 我比賽跑步。
I participated in the running competition.

S.FORM: Tmalang ku siida o, mtakur ku da msdara egu bi ka pungu qaqay mu.
S.TRANSL: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

S.FORM: Ida ku tutuy, tmalang ku musa brah duri.
S.TRANSL: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。
But I stood up and continued running forward.

S.FORM: Dhuq ku siida mqaras bi kana ka dhiya.
S.TRANSL: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

S.FORM: Ana ku ini angal kaci, ida ku mqaras bi, yasa wada ku mnhdu pspung da.
S.TRANSL: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

S.FORM: Shiga, Mnusa nami qmita swayi snaw Tama mu ka dha nami Tama mu.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔。
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

S.FORM: Gaga mangal luqih ka qaqay swayi snaw Tama mu.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔的腳受傷了。
My uncle injured his foot.

S.FORM: Rmngaw yami ka hiya, gaga mbling ka babaw dnamux.
S.TRANSL: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

S.FORM: Smalu dnamux siida ka hiya o, dburuq knnadax dnamux da.
S.TRANSL: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。
He fell off the roof while repairing it.

S.FORM: Madas wawa dapa ni pinglang ka Tama mu, bqana na swayi na snaw.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

S.FORM: Pprngaw nami tqiyan ka dha nami swayi snaw Tama mu, egubi ka snluan kari niya.
S.TRANSL: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

S.FORM: Mmusa ku siida, rngagan ku na masu wada mdakil bi hnigan ni mseejiq bi ka swayi snaw Tama mu.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

S.FORM: Smiyuk ku rnngaw, “tay malu ka qaqay su da o, iyax bi mseupu tuhuy sapah.”
S.TRANSL: come to our house next time and visit us.""
I said, When your foot gets better

S.FORM: Hngkawas empusal kbkuy empusal dha siida, mneuda pprngaw ka klwaan tduwa burux powsa hangan kari ta nanaq ka patas hnyigan Seejiq Tnpusu.
S.TRANSL: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

S.FORM: Smniling ku risaw alang Walis Huwac, hiya o bsiyaq balay mquri klwaan embiyax meysa patas hnyigan “ burux powsa hangan kari ta nanaq.
S.TRANSL: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年Walis Huwac。
I interviewed Walis Huwac, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

S.FORM: Mnhdu nami pprngaw , jiyax sngayan nii musa sapah na smiling hyaan.
S.TRANSL: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

S.FORM: Saw mniq sniling siida, pgkla knan pnyahan hangan na, dsun ku na pgkla kingal ruwan sapah na ni alang na uri.
S.TRANSL: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

S.FORM: Smiling ku hyaan, hmuya ma su ida mkray lnglungan priyux hangan, uda powsa patas seuxal o naqih kiya hug?
S.TRANSL: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn't the old registration method sufficient?

S.FORM: Rngagan ku na, yaasa dmuuy kari Tlu o ini sleexan balay pgkla hanagan na, duma seejiq “瓦先生” msa mlawa hyaan uri, kiya ni saw bi smhulis.
S.TRANSL: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Wa Xian Sheng

S.FORM: Rmngaw ka Walis Huwac, “Hangan bnatas kari Seejiq Tnpusu o kika balay bi hangan ta. Hangan mu o ririh saw pgkla klgan seejiq ta, tnsapah ta, hnyigan ta, tay saw emphbaraw balay ka seejiq dhuq hmlay hangan dha nanaq.”
S.TRANSL: our family
Walis Huwac said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

S.FORM: Shiga o musa sbrigan smbarig ka yaku ni bubu rudan, madas egu bi ssama nhuma na nanaq ka bubu rudan, smmalu uuqun Seejiq Tnpusu uri biqan na ana ima.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

S.FORM: Smkuxul bi sbrigan bubu rudan ka kana seejiq, hbaraw bi seejiq marig usik ni bunga, hbaraw bi seejiq miyah mkan nhapuy hnpuyan na.
S.TRANSL: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和地瓜很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。
Everyone loved my grandmother's stall. Many people bought the chilis and sweet potato, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

S.FORM: Lmala ni hlama dhquy hnpuyan na o malu balay uqan, niqan muduh hiyi bowyak uri, hmguc hbaraw lupung mniyah ka knux na, miyah tqnay sbrigan nami kana.
S.TRANSL: 她煮的過貓和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用山豬肉煮的馬告滷肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

S.FORM: Mhapuy siida ka bubu rudan, mniq ku siyaw kmeaguh lupung ka yaku, mjiras ku mlawa siyaw, “Hmaan nanaq kana ka ssama, ini rusi sapuh, iyah marig nhari wah!”
S.TRANSL: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!\""
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

S.FORM: Ini biyaw qduun smbarig kana ka qyqaya nami da, “Nuxay bi jiyagan su” msa ka bubu rudan.
S.TRANSL: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It's all thanks to your help.\""

S.FORM: Euda nii, wada ku smluhay pnegluban quri knkla pnhmaan ni uqun Seejiq Tnpusu, duri ni mkrbuk muda smbarig.
S.TRANSL: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

S.FORM: Qmita ku bubu rudan smkuxul bi uuqun Seejiq Tnpusu smparu ni mqaras bi lnglungan mu.
S.TRANSL: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
Seeing my grandmother's passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
